intro: Bidens helianthoides, commonly known as the common beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its yellow flowers with five petals and bristly seed capsules that release tiny seeds when disturbed. The plant typically grows in moist to wet environments such as marshes and along stream banks. It has hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture, and it is often found in disturbed soils. Bidens helianthoides is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
